content: अशोक {%<ab>a.</ab>%} Without sorrow, not feeling or causing sorrow. --कः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of a tree having red flowers (Jonesia Aśoka Roxb.); (said, according to the convention of poets, to put forth flowers when struck by ladies with the foot decked with jingling anklets; <ab>cf.</ab> असूत सद्यः कुसुमान्यशोकः… पादेन नापैक्षत सुंदरीणां संपर्कमाशिंजितनूपुरेण <ls>Ku. 3. 26</ls>; <ls>Me. 78</ls>; <ls>R. 8. 62</ls>; <ls>M. 3. 12</ls>, <ls n="M. 3.">16</ls>; also पादाघातादशोकस्तिलककुरबकौ वीक्षणालिंगनाभ्यां स्त्रीणां स्पशांत् प्रियंगुविंकसति बकुलः सीधुगंडूषसेकात् . मंदारो नर्मवाक्यात् पटुमृटुहसनाच्चंपको वक्त्रवातात् चूतो गीतान्नमेरुविंकसति च पुरो नर्तनात्कर्णिकारः). {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a minister of king Daśaratha. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of a celebrated king of the Maurya dynasty, said to have reigned from 234-198 <ab>B. C.</ab> {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of the tree बकुल. --कं {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of a medical plant (कटुक). {@--2@} The sixth day in the first half of Chaitra. {@--3@} One of the female domestic deities of the Jainas. --का {@--1@} Quicksilver. {@--2@} The blossom of the Aśoka plant (forming one of the five arrows of Cupid).
